briefdescription.para: Whether a capture is currently in progress.

detaileddescription.para: True if a capture is in progress.

briefdescription.para: Whether a replay is currently being run by the component.

detaileddescription.para: True if replay is running.

briefdescription.para: If true, input recording is started immediately when the component is enabled.

detaileddescription.para: Disabled by default. Call StartCapture to manually start capturing.
True if component will start recording automatically in OnEnable.
Number of captured events.
Size of captured events in bytes.

briefdescription.para: Total size of capture memory currently allocated.

detaileddescription.para: Size of memory allocated for capture.

briefdescription.para: Whether to record frame marker events when capturing input.

detaileddescription.para: Enabled by default.
True if frame marker events will be recorded.

briefdescription.para: Whether to record only StateEvents and DeltaStateEvents.

detaileddescription.para: Disabled by default.
True if anything but state events should be ignored.

briefdescription.para: Path that constrains the devices to record from.

detaileddescription.para: Input control path to match devices or null/empty.

By default, this is not set. Meaning that input will be recorded from all devices. By setting this property to a path, only events for devices that match the given path (as dictated by InputControlPath.Matches) will be recorded from.
By setting this property to the exact path of a device at runtime, recording can be restricted to just that device.

briefdescription.para: The underlying event trace that contains the captured input events.

detaileddescription.para: Underlying event trace.
This will be null if no capture is currently associated with the recorder.

briefdescription.para: The replay controller for when a replay is running.

detaileddescription.para: Replay controller for the event trace while replay is running.

briefdescription.para: Whether a replay should create new devices or replay recorded events as is.

detaileddescription.para: Disabled by default.
True if replay should temporary create new devices.

briefdescription.para: Whether to attempt to re-create the original event timing when replaying events.

detaileddescription.para: Disabled by default.
If true, events are queued based on their timestamp rather than based on their recorded frames (if any).

briefdescription.para: A wrapper component around InputEventTrace that provides an easy interface for recording input from a GameObject.

detaileddescription.para: This component comes with a custom inspector that provides an easy recording and playback interface and also gives feedback about what has been recorded in the trace. The interface also allows saving and loading event traces.
Capturing can either be constrained by a devicePath or capture all input occuring in the system.

Replay by default will happen frame by frame (see InputEventTrace.ReplayController.PlayAllFramesOneByOne). If frame markers are disabled (see recordFrames), all events are queued right away in the first frame and replay completes immediately.

Other than frame-by-frame, replay can be made to happen in a way that tries to simulate the original input timing. To do so, enable simulateOriginalTimingOnReplay. This will make use of InputEventTrace.ReplayController.PlayAllEventsAccordingToTimestamps
